meanings.definition: of or relating to the lumen of a body part
meanings.sent1: The luminal lining of the intestine helps with digestion.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use a special camera to see the luminal area inside the body.
meanings.sent3: The luminal glow of the nightlight made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her luminal smile brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The luminal colors of the sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: situated or occurring within a lumen
meanings.sent1: The luminal space inside the tube was very narrow.
meanings.sent2: The luminal fluid flowed smoothly through the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The luminal surprise inside the box made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His luminal voice echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The luminal glow of the fireflies lit up the dark forest.

meanings.definition: relating to or situated on the inside of a structure or space
meanings.sent1: The luminal side of the door had intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: She explored the luminal chambers of the ancient castle.
meanings.sent3: The luminal secret passage led to a hidden garden.
meanings.sent4: His luminal thoughts were known only to him.
meanings.sent5: The luminal warmth of the fireplace filled the room with comfort.
